cluster.display: Although __________ are variable they are intended to represent the population from which they come.
Although samples are __________ they are intended to represent the population from which they come.
Although samples are variable they are intended to __________ the population from which they come.
Although samples are variable they are intended to represent the __________ from which they come.
When a study __________ human subjects, the sample is the group of people who participated in the study.
When a study involves human __________s, the sample is the group of people who participated in the study.
When a study involves human subjects, the __________ is the group of people who participated in the study.
When a study involves human subjects, the sample is the group of people who __________ in the study.
A __________ describes a characteristic of a sample.
A statistic __________ a characteristic of a sample.
A statistic describes a __________ of a sample.
A statistic describes a characteristic of a __________.
The __________, or average, is a statistic that represents what we expect for observations in the sample.
The sample mean, or average, is a __________ that represents what we expect for observations in the sample.
The sample mean, or average, is a statistic that __________ what we expect for observations in the sample.
The sample mean, or average, is a statistic that represents what we __________ for observations in the sample.
The __________ is computed by taking the sum of all the numbers in a set divided by the count of the numbers in the set.
The mean is computed by taking the __________ of all the numbers in a set divided by the count of the numbers in the set.
The mean is computed by taking the sum of all the numbers in a set __________ by the count of the numbers in the set.
The mean is computed by taking the sum of all the numbers in a set divided by the __________ of the numbers in the set.
__________ refers to how different the observations are from each other and the mean.
Variability refers to how __________ the observations are from each other and the mean.
Variability refers to how different the __________ are from each other and the mean.
Variability refers to how different the observations are from each other and the __________.
The __________ for an observation is the squared difference from the mean.
The variance for an observation is the __________ difference from the mean.
The variance for an observation is the squared __________ from the mean.
The variance for an observation is the squared difference from the __________.
The __________ for a sample is computed by dividing the sum of the observation __________s by 1 less than the total observations.
The variance for a __________ is computed by dividing the sum of the observation variances by 1 less than the total observations.
The variance for a sample is computed by __________ the sum of the observation variances by 1 less than the total observations.
The variance for a sample is computed by dividing the sum of the observation variances by __________ less than the total observations.
The __________ is a statistic that describes typical variability for an observation.
The standard deviation is a __________ that describes typical variability for an observation.
The standard deviation is a statistic that describes typical __________ for an observation.
The standard deviation is a statistic that describes typical variability for an __________.
__________ is the square root of the variance, also known as root mean squared error.
Standard deviation is the __________ of the variance, also known as root mean squared error.
Standard deviation is the square root of the __________, also known as root mean squared error.
Standard deviation is the square root of the variance, also known as __________.
The __________ for the standard deviation are the same __________ used to measure the observations.
The units for the __________ are the same units used to measure the observations.
The units for the standard deviation are the __________ units used to measure the observations.
The units for the standard deviation are the same units used to __________ the observations.
__________ refers to how individual observations vary and standard error refers to how multiple observations vary.
Standard deviation refers to how __________ observations vary and standard error refers to how multiple observations vary.
Standard deviation refers to how individual observations vary and __________ refers to how multiple observations vary.
Standard deviation refers to how individual observations vary and standard error refers to how __________ observations vary.
A __________ describes the likelihood that observations will occur within any range of values.
A distribution describes the __________ that observations will occur within any range of values.
A distribution describes the likelihood that __________ will occur within any range of values.
A distribution describes the likelihood that observations will occur within any __________ of values.
The __________ of a distribution between a range of values represents the probability that a new observation will fall within that range also.
The density of a distribution between a __________ of values represents the probability that a new observation will fall within that __________ also.
The density of a distribution between a range of values represents the __________ that a new observation will fall within that range also.
The density of a distribution between a range of values represents the probability that a new __________ will fall within that range also.
A __________ distribution is symmetric, so for example, the probability between -1 and 0 is equal to the probability between 0 and 1.
A normal distribution is __________, so for example, the probability between -1 and 0 is equal to the probability between 0 and 1.
A normal distribution is symmetric, so for example, the __________ between -1 and 0 is equal to the probability between 0 and 1.
A normal distribution is symmetric, so for example, the probability between -1 and 0 is __________ to the probability between 0 and 1.
The __________ distribution has 68 percent of its observations in the range between -1 and 1 standard deviation.
The normal distribution has __________ percent of its observations in the range between -1 and 1 standard deviation.
The normal distribution has 68 percent of its observations in the __________ between -1 and 1 standard deviation.
The normal distribution has 68 percent of its observations in the range between -__________ and __________ standard deviation.
The __________ distribution has 95 percent of its observations in the range between -2 and 2 standard deviations.
The normal distribution has __________ percent of its observations in the range between -2 and 2 standard deviations.
The normal distribution has 95 percent of its observations in the __________ between -2 and 2 standard deviations.
The normal distribution has 95 percent of its observations in the range between -__________ and __________ standard deviations.
The __________ distribution has 99.7 percent of its observations in the range between -3 and 3 standard deviations.
The normal distribution has __________ percent of its observations in the range between -3 and 3 standard deviations.
The normal distribution has 99.7 percent of its observations in the __________ between -3 and 3 standard deviations.
The normal distribution has 99.7 percent of its observations in the range between -__________ and __________ standard deviations.
